intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. erectus, commonly known as the upright buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features delicate, bright yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-shaped center and deeply lobed petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for garden cultivation and ecological restoration projects.
